intro: Oenanthe dubia, commonly known as the slender water dropwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often near streams or in damp soils. Its slender stems are usually unbranched, and it produces small, white or greenish flowers in umbels. The leaves are lance-shaped and can be somewhat hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
